intro: Ixora kratensis, commonly known as the flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its bright orange to red flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Ixora kratensis typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical gardens.
